quest.name: An Unwanted Truth
journal: Philiot is searching for a friend of Garlond Ironworks.

As he tells it, Garlond Ironworks has detected a strange energy signature emanating from the Fractal Continuum in Azys Lla. Knowing what Allagan horrors once roamed its confines, they dare not investigate alone. To that end, Philiot was sent to request your assistance. You consent, and he readies himself for a long journey to Azys Lla.

You arrive at Azys Lla to find Philiot consulting with himself about one of the teleporters at Matter Conduit VI–VII. From what you can hear of his conversation, an intruder in the Fractal Continuum has triggered its anti-intruder systems, ruling out entrance via teleportation. The thought of piloting the Enterprise to get inside terrifies Philiot. Thankfully, he will be accompanied by the Warrior of Light. With you at his side, he musters up the courage to board the airship and embark on a journey to the depths of the Allagans' great technological museum.

The Fractal Continuum was plagued with all manner of chimerical horrors, and even prototypes for one of the Allagans' most dreaded creations─the Ultima Weapon. Much to Philiot's relief, your surpassing strength proved the reason for their inferiority. With the source of the strange signal decommissioned, he suggests returning to Matter Conduit VI–VII to confirm the teleporters are once again operational.

The teleporters are fully functional, but there still remains the matter of the intruder who first locked them. You spy an Ixal in the distance with his head hung low whom Philiot presumes was the cause for your troubles. Considering the difficulty of reaching Azys Lla via an ordinary airship, he surmises the Ehcatl Nine are the only Ixal with the technological know-how to have made the voyage. He wishes to have a word with them for fear of another incident in the Fractal Continuum.

You arrive in the Black Shroud to find Kezul, the Ixal who ventured to Azys Lla, being scolded by the leader of the Ehcatl Nine, Sezul. Though he is furious at Kezul for stealing their airship, Sezul calms himself to ask why he would risk his life to return there. The answer is alarming. Among the chimerical monstrosities lining the walls of the Fractal Continuum, Kezul came across a creature that bears a striking resemblance to the Ixal. He soon came to the startling realization that they are a failed experiment of the Allagans, and the Ayatlan they yearned to return to is nothing more than a test tube. Sezul cares not for this revelation, reminding Kezul the dreams of the Ehcatl Nine were born from no one but themselves. They agree to keep this truth hidden from the others, and continue to search for a place the Ixal can call paradise.

Philiot is moved by the strength of Sezul's conviction. His resolve to continue pursuing a paradise for the Ixal has motivated Philiot to pursue his aspirations of becoming an engineer worthy of Garlond Ironworks.
objectives: Speak with Philiot in Azys Lla at Matter Conduit VI–VII.
Speak with Philiot at Matter Conduit VI–VII.
Speak with Philiot in the North Shroud at Ehcatl.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Excuse me, misssir. You're Forename, right?

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: The name's Philiot. Newly joined to the Garlond Ironworks. Pleased to meet you.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: I hate to be a bother, but I've got somewhere I'd like to take you. Wedge told me he once asked you to peek inside the Fractal Continuum, is that right?

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Well, the thing is...we've recently detected a strange signal coming from inside.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Knowing our luck, it's likely some ancient Allagan weapon run amok, but we won't know for sure until someone goes in to find out.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: We were hoping that someone'd be you, if you're up for the job.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Oh, thank the gods. I'll see you in Azys Lla then.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Alright. Time to take a look at this here teleporter...

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text:
What in blazes? “Access Restricted”?
...This isn't good. Someone's already triggered the intruder defense system.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: The only way in now would be aboard an airship. But that would mean... <gulp> piloting the Enterprise. Bloody hells, how am I supposed to─

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Forename! I─I didn't... You didn't hear that...did you?

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: <sigh> You deserve better from the Ironworks. But the truth is, I'm just a simple man from the Brume, meant for simple tasks. This is beyond me.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: With you here, though, I suppose things'll work out. Right?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Leave everything to me.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: To be honest, I'm worried too.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: You're a saint, truly. Suddenly I'm not so nervous anymore.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: You're only saying that to make me feel better. Well, it worked! Thank you.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Now then. As you might've overheard a moment ago, the teleporter's been locked. Seems someone beat us here and activated the defense systems.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: It's nothing the Enterprise can't handle, though. Once we've locked on to the signal, we can fly straight to its source in the blink of an eye. We'll depart as soon as you're ready.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: The Enterprise can fly us to the signal's source in the blink of an eye. Say the word and we'll be off.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: By Halone, how are we in one piece?

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: At least now we know for certain Allagan weapons were the source of the signal.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: But why would they need ultima weapon prototypes in there? On second thought, I'd rather not know the answer to that.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: I presume he was the one who woke the bloody things up. I tried talking to him, but only got sullen silence for my troubles.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: On the bright side, the teleporter should be functional now. That's assuming, of course, there's no one else lurking about.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Well, would you look at that. Up and operational.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: But how do you think that Ixal reached Azys Lla in the first place? There's no way their balloons can reach these altitudes.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: ...Unless the rumors are true. They say a group of Ixal in the North Shroud calling themselves the Ehcatl Nine has been working on some sort of hybrid airship.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: How's about we go and pay them a visit, eh? The last thing we need is for one of them to come back here and wake up another of the Allagans' delightful toys.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: There you are. Well, come on then. Let's go and have a word with the Ixal.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Seems I was right. That's him over there, getting an earful from his superior no doubt.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Take Dezul Qualan without permission, you did! Squawk! Banish you from the Ehcatl Nine, I should!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Take uncomplete ship without permission, you did! Squawk! Banish you from the Ehcatl Nine, I should!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: ...Forgive you this once, I will. But tell me true, Kezul─did you find Ayatlan?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Well!? Say something! Caw!

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text:
Ayatlan? Isn't that some faerie tale island the Ixal are said to have come from?
...Of course! That's why they've been building the airship.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Ahem. Pardon the intrusion. Might I have a word with Kezul?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: What's this?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Good to see you, it is. Come, what is it you need?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Come, what is it you need?

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Featherless ones? What business have you with the Ehcatl Nine?

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Meet with them in the Fractal Continuum, I did... In Azys Lla.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Azys Lla? Why would you go back?

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Lined with tubes, the walls were. Filled with all manner of chimerical creations.

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: In the last of the chambers a terrible sight, I saw. It...it looked like us, Sezul. Named Iksalion, it was.

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: To serve the Allagans, they were made. Developed for an airborne division. Obey any order, they will.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: That sounds an awful lot like you Ixal, doesn't it? They say the Windrisen up in Coerthas follow their superior's commands with frightening obedience. Little wonder why you all left to make your own tribe.

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Much the same, it sounds. But end there, the similarities do not. Weak to the elements, the Iksalion were. And riddled with genetic instabilities.

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Does that not strike you as familiar? Unfit for the forests. Unfit to fly... An abomination, we are! A failed experiment of the Allagans. If Ayatlan exists, in a test tube, it lies.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk, squawk! Silence!

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: If Ayatlan is the damnable laboratory of Allagans, then seek paradise elsewhere, we must.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: My desire to fly, to find our home in the sky─created by science, these are not.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Can we not aspire to greatness!? After all, made to dream, we were not.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Speak of this again, you will not. Understand? None will deny the Ixal's ambitions. Not even you!

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Forgive me, I...I was wrong. Our paradise. Ayatlan. Find it in Azys Lla, I did not. But someday I will, together with the Ehcatl Nine!

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Well, it looks like you've already resolved the matter we came to discuss. You won't be returning to Azys Lla, I take it?

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Never. Even at the threat of death, return there, we will not.

dialogue.name: SEZULTOTOLOC
dialogue.text: Squawk! Enough talking, Kezu. Prepare yourself. For stealing our airship, a most severe punishment, you will receive.

dialogue.name: KEZULITZCAN
dialogue.text: Squawk!? But...but Sezul!

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Everything's settled then, eh? And who would've thought the Ixal actually came from Azys Lla? I'd have lost all my feathers after hearing news like that.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: But they've chosen to keep a stiff upper lip...or beak, I suppose. And here I am being hard on myself for my upbringing in the Brume. Piss all compared to their hardships.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: If they won't give up on their dreams, then I won't on mine.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Looks like I've got my work cut out for me if I'm to be even half the engineer Cid is.

dialogue.name: PHILIOT
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. For everything.
